meanings.definition: Capable of being changed or transformed.
meanings.sent1: The toy blocks were transmutable, allowing children to create various shapes.
meanings.sent2: The transmutable nature of the weather made it unpredictable.
meanings.sent3: The transmutable colors of the chameleon amazed the zoo visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as transmutable as the weather in spring.
meanings.sent5: The artist's palette was a transmutable canvas of endless possibilities.

meanings.definition: Able to be altered or converted.
meanings.sent1: The recipe was transmutable, allowing for different variations of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The transmutable data could be easily manipulated for analysis.
meanings.sent3: The transmutable fabric changed color under different lights.
meanings.sent4: His opinion was as transmutable as the wind direction.
meanings.sent5: The transmutable nature of technology keeps advancing at a rapid pace.

meanings.sent1: The contract was transmutable, pending approval from both parties.
meanings.sent2: The transmutable rules of the game kept players on their toes.
meanings.sent3: The transmutable schedule caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent4: Her plans were as transmutable as the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The transmutable nature of fashion trends keeps the industry dynamic.
